recipe_title: Red Wine Roast Chicken (Poulet Roti Au Vin Rouge)
original_instructions:
Mix together the wine, tomato paste, thyme, marjoram, and vinegar. Season the chicken with plenty of salt and pepper, then place in a resealable bag with the wine mixture. Shake the bag to make sure each piece is well coated. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight.
Place the potatoes in a saucepan of cold water, cover, and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then drain in a colander.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange the onions, carrots, and cooked potatoes in a large baking dish or tray and pour in the water.
Arrange the chicken pieces, skin-side up, in a layer on top of the vegetables in the dish. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Cover with a sheet of parchment or foil and roast for 30 minutes. Remove the parchment and baste the chicken with the cooking liquid. Roast, uncovered, for another 15 minutes, or until the skin is crisp. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 sprigs marjoram, leaves picked, or 1/2 teaspoon dried
1 whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces (about 3 1/2 pounds)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Mix together 2 tablespoons red wine, 1.5 tablespoons tomato paste, a few thyme leaves, a few marjoram leaves, and 1.5 tablespoons red wine vinegar.

Season a single chicken piece with salt and pepper, then place it in a resealable bag with the wine mixture. Shake the bag to coat the chicken piece well. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight.
Place about 2.25 ounces of baby potatoes in a saucepan of cold water, cover, and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then drain in a colander.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Arrange about a quarter of an onion, a quarter of a carrot, and the cooked potatoes in a small baking dish or tray and pour in 1 tablespoon of water.
Place the chicken piece, skin-side up, on top of the vegetables in the dish.
Pour the marinade over the chicken.
Cover with a sheet of parchment or foil and roast for 30 minutes.
Remove the parchment and baste the chicken with the cooking liquid.
Roast, uncovered, for another 15 minutes, or until the skin is crisp.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the bones, cut-side up, onto a baking sheet and cook the marrow until soft and slightly separating from the bone, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, boil salted water for potatoes and let them cook until soft, about 25 minutes.
Remove the marrow bones and keep aside. Drain the potatoes and add the melted butter and cream. Mash until smooth. Using a spoon, scoop out the marrow with the juices and add to the mash. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 6 center-cut beef marrow bones, about 3-inches long
1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Place 1 center-cut beef marrow bone, cut-side up, onto a baking sheet and cook the marrow until soft and slightly separating from the bone, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, boil salted water for 1 Yukon gold potato and let it cook until soft, about 25 minutes.
Remove the marrow bone and keep aside.
Drain the potato and add 1 tablespoon melted butter and 1 tablespoon heavy cream.
Mash until smooth.
Using a spoon, scoop out the marrow with the juices and add to the mash.
Add 1 tablespoon fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves and season with salt and freshly ground pepper.

recipe_title: Shrimp with Tomatoes, Basil, and Garlic
original_instructions:
In a medium bowl, combine the tomatoes and basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside while you saute the shrimp.
Put the shrimp in a pie pan and pat them completely dry with a paper towel. Arrange the shrimp so they lay flat and are evenly spaced in the pan.
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Season one side of the shrimp with salt and pepper; add the oil to the pan and turn the heat to high. Invert the pie pan over the skillet so the shrimp fall into the pan all at once.
Saute the shrimp, undisturbed, until they turn golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic to the pan. Turn the shrimp over with tongs. Turn the heat off and cook the shrimp for 1 minute in the residual heat of the pan. Shake the pan to combine the shrimp with the garlic and then transfer them to the bowl with the tomato mixture. Toss to combine. Serve hot or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1/2 cup quartered vine-ripened grape or cherry tomatoes
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh basil leaves
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
6 ounces medium-large shrimp, shelled and deveined
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium bowl, combine 0.25 cup of quartered tomatoes and 1 teaspoon of finely chopped basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside while you saute the shrimp.
Put 3 ounces of shrimp in a pie pan and pat them completely dry with a paper towel. Arrange the shrimp so they lay flat and are evenly spaced in the pan.
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Season one side of the shrimp with salt and pepper; add 1 teaspoon of oil to the pan and turn the heat to high.
Invert the pie pan over the skillet so the shrimp fall into the pan all at once.
Saute the shrimp, undisturbed, until they turn golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes.
Add 0.25 small clove of minced garlic to the pan.
Turn the shrimp over with tongs.
Turn the heat off and cook the shrimp for 1 minute in the residual heat of the pan.
Shake the pan to combine the shrimp with the garlic and then transfer them to the bowl with the tomato mixture.
Toss to combine. Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
In a heavy kettle ( at least 5 quarts) cook bacon over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp. Add onions and cook, stirring, until softened. Peel potatoes and cut into 3/4-inch cubes. Add potatoes, celery, broth, and water and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Add lima beans and corn and simmer, covered, 5 minutes.
In a small bowl dissolve cornstarch in half -and-half or milk and stir into simmering soup with Worcestershire sauce. Bring soup to a boil, stirring, and add fish. ( If using smoked trout, no further cooking is necessary; if using finnan haddie or fresh fish, simmer, covered, 5 minutes, or until it just flakes.) Stir in parsley or dill. Soup may be made 2 days ahead (cool uncovered before chilling covered). Reheat gently.
ingredients: 10 ounce package frozen baby lima beans
1 pound finnan haddie (smoked haddock), cut into 1-inch pieces, or 2 smoked trout, skinned, boned, and flaked into 1-inch pieces, or fresh fillets of cod, haddock, halibut or snapper
3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves or fresh dill
step_by_step_instructions: Cook 0.5 sliced bacon (approximately 0.2 oz) in a heavy kettle over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp.
Add 0.25 medium chopped onion (approximately 1 oz) and cook, stirring, until softened.
Peel 0.4 pounds of russet potato and cut into 3/4-inch cubes.
Add 0.4 pounds of potato, 0.2 chopped celery rib (approximately 0.5 oz), 0.38 cups chicken broth, and 0.38 cups water to the kettle and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
Add 2 oz frozen baby lima beans and 2 oz frozen corn to the kettle and simmer, covered, for another 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, dissolve 0.25 teaspoon cornstarch in 0.38 cups half-and-half or milk.
Stir the cornstarch mixture into the simmering soup with 0.25 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce.
Bring soup to a boil, stirring continuously.
Add 0.25 pounds smoked haddock cut into 1-inch pieces and simmer, covered, for 5 minutes, or until the fish just flakes.
Stir in 0.5 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves.
Serve immediately or cool and store for up to 2 days. Reheat gently before serving.

original_instructions:
Stir together soy sauce, water, lime juice, ginger, sugar, and scallion. Coarsely crush peppercorns and coriander with a mortar and pestle or heavy skillet. Sprinkle tuna with 3/4 tsp salt, then press spice mixture evenly all over fish. Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then sear tuna, turning once, about 6 minutes for medium-rare. Serve with dipping sauce.
Stir together soy sauce, water, lime juice, ginger, sugar, and scallion.
Coarsely crush peppercorns and coriander with a mortar and pestle or heavy skillet. Sprinkle tuna with 3/4 tsp salt, then press spice mixture evenly all over fish.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then sear tuna, turning once, about 6 minutes for medium-rare.
Serve with dipping sauce.
step_by_step_instructions: Stir together 0.75 tablespoons soy sauce, 0.5 tablespoons water, 0.25 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 0.125 teaspoons grated peeled ginger, 0.125 teaspoons sugar, and 0.25 tablespoons scallion.
Coarsely crush 0.42 teaspoons black peppercorns, 0.08 teaspoons white peppercorns, and 0.17 teaspoons coriander seeds with a mortar and pestle or a heavy skillet.
Sprinkle 0.13 teaspoons salt evenly over 0.5 pounds tuna steak, then press the spice mixture evenly all over the fish.
Heat 0.33 tablespoons vegetable oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers.
Sear the tuna, turning once, about 3 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Serve the tuna steak with the prepared dipping sauce.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Salt the water and add the pasta. Cook to al dente and drain.
Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the anchovy paste and let it melt into the oil. Add the onions and bay leaf and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cook the onions until very soft and light caramel in color, about 20 minutes. Stir in the cream, and cook until heated through. Remove the bay leaf, then add the pasta and cheese and toss to coat. Transfer to a serving bowl, sprinkle with parsley and serve.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon anchovy paste or 4 flat fillets
1/2 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, a couple of handfuls
1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat.
Salt the water and add approximately 2.67 ounces of whole-wheat penne pasta.
Cook the pasta until al dente, then drain.
Heat 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Stir in 0.17 teaspoon of anchovy paste and let it melt into the oil.
Add 5.33 ounces of thinly sliced onions and one small bay leaf to the skillet.
Season the onions with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Cook the onions until they are very soft and a light caramel color, about 20 minutes.
Stir in 0.17 cup of cream and cook until heated through.
Remove the bay leaf from the mixture.
Add the drained pasta and 0.17 cup of grated Parmigiano-Reggiano to the skillet.
Toss everything to coat the pasta.
Transfer the pasta to a serving bowl and sprinkle with 0.67 tablespoon of finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley.
Serve immediately.
processed_ingredients: 0.67 tbsp finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley

recipe_title: Cucumber and Celery Salad with Yogurt
original_instructions:
In a cheesecloth-lined sieve or colander set over a bowl drain yogurt, covered and chilled, 20 minutes. Discard liquid. Diagonally cut celery into thin slices. Seed cucumber and diagonally cut into thin slices. In bowl toss together celery, cucumber, yogurt, parsley or cilantro, lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
In a cheesecloth-lined sieve or colander set over a bowl drain yogurt, covered and chilled, 20 minutes. Discard liquid.
Diagonally cut celery into thin slices. Seed cucumber and diagonally cut into thin slices. In bowl toss together celery, cucumber, yogurt, parsley or cilantro, lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leafed parsley or cilantro leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Line a sieve or colander with cheesecloth and set it over a bowl.
Place 0.06 cup yogurt in the lined sieve, cover and chill for 20 minutes.
After chilling, discard the liquid from the yogurt.
Diagonally cut 0.5 celery rib into thin slices.
Seed 0.25 English cucumber and diagonally cut into thin slices.

In a bowl, combine the celery slices, cucumber slices, drained yogurt, 0.5 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, 0.5 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 0.25 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
Toss all the ingredients together to mix well.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice chicken breasts lengthwise into 1-inch wide strips. Place on a rimmed baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with thyme and salt and pepper. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through but still juicy; do not overcook.
While chicken is cooking; cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta, rinse in cold water and drain again. Pat excess moisture off pasta with a paper towel, if necessary.
Combine mayonnaise, green onions, parsley, basil, House Seasoning, lemon juice and seasoned salt. Pour dressing over pasta and toss gently.
Place chicken strips on top of pasta.
Mix ingredients together and store in an airtight container for up to 6 months.
ingredients: 4 large boneless skinless chicken breast halves
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 teaspoon The Lady's House Seasoning, divided, recipe follows
1 teaspoon seasoned salt (recommended: The Lady's Seasoned Salt)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Slice 1 chicken breast lengthwise into 1-inch wide strips.
Place chicken strips on a rimmed baking sheet and drizzle with 0.75 tablespoon olive oil.
Sprinkle with 0.5 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme leaves, salt, and freshly ground black pepper.
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through but still juicy; do not overcook.
While chicken is cooking, cook 4.5 ounces of fresh fettuccine according to package directions.
Drain pasta, rinse in cold water and drain again.
Pat excess moisture off pasta with a paper towel, if necessary.

Combine 0.5 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon freshly chopped green onions, 0.5 tablespoon freshly chopped parsley leaves, 0.5 tablespoon freshly chopped basil leaves, 0.25 teaspoon The Lady's House Seasoning, 0.25 teaspoon lemon juice, and 0.25 teaspoon seasoned salt.
Pour dressing over pasta and toss gently.
Place chicken strips on top of pasta.

original_instructions:
In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, bring the vinegar, salt, mustard seeds, chile flakes and 3 cups water to a simmer. Cook until the salt has dissolved, about 5 minutes.
Divide the dill, garlic, zucchini and onions evenly between 2 quart-size mason jars.
Pour the hot liquid into the mason jars to cover the ingredients and let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour. Serve immediately or cover with lids and store in the refrigerator for up to a week.
ingredients: 3 medium zucchini (about 2 pounds), sliced into 1/2-inch-thick rounds
1 small red onion, halved and sliced into thin half-moons
step_by_step_instructions: In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring 0.25 cups distilled white vinegar, 0.37 tsp kosher salt, 0.25 tbsp yellow mustard seeds, 0.17 tsp red chile flakes and 0.37 cups water to a simmer.
Cook until the salt has dissolved, about 5 minutes.

Divide 1 sprig fresh dill, 0.67 cloves garlic, thinly sliced, 0.5 medium zucchini, sliced into 1/2-inch-thick rounds, and 0.17 small red onion, halved and sliced into thin half-moons between two small containers.
Pour the hot liquid into the containers to cover the ingredients and let cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Serve immediately or cover with lids and store in the refrigerator for up to a week.

original_instructions: Halve the squash. Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute the squash 5 minutes then add the onions and tomatoes, season the vegetables with salt and pepper and cook 5 to 7 minutes more until the tomatoes begin to burst and the onions are warmed through. Toss the herbs with the vegetables and transfer to a serving dish.;
ingredients: 1 pound assorted mini squash - patty pans and/or baby zucchini
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Halve approximately 0.25 pounds of mini squash.
Heat 0.75 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Saute the squash for 5 minutes.
Add 0.25 cups of frozen pearl onions and 0.25 pints of cherry tomatoes to the skillet.
Season the vegetables with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Cook for 5 to 7 minutes more until the tomatoes begin to burst and the onions are warmed through.
Toss 0.75 tablespoons of chopped fresh dill and a small handful (approximately 0.25 ounces) of chopped flat-leaf parsley with the vegetables.
Transfer the vegetables to a serving dish.

original_instructions: In a large skillet combine carrots, butter sugar and water. Simmer carrots, covered until just tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Uncover and continue to cook until the water has evaporated and the butter and sugar have formed a glaze.;
ingredients: 2 pounds carrots sliced on the diagonal
step_by_step_instructions: In a large skillet, combine approximately 0.25 pounds of sliced carrots, 0.19 tablespoons of unsalted butter, 0.06 teaspoons of sugar, and 0.06 cups of water.
Simmer the carrots, covered, until just tender, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Uncover and continue to cook until the water has evaporated and the butter and sugar have formed a glaze.

original_instructions:
Place the flours, salt, eggs, and half of the olive oil in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade or an electric mixer fitted with a dough hook. Mix or process until the dough forms a ball. Turn the dough out into a clean bowl and cover with a damp towel, Let it rest at room temperature for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Using a pasta machine or a rolling pin, roll out the dough until it is very thin, like lasagna (number 1 on the pasta machine or as thin as possible without tearing). You should have approximately 6 sheets, about 6 by 10-inches each.
Place the dough on baking sheets and brush very lightly with the remaining olive oil. Sprinkle lightly with the salt, thyme, and onion. Bake the matzoh for about 10 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
step_by_step_instructions: Place 0.19 cups semolina flour, 0.19 cups all-purpose flour, 0.25 teaspoons salt, 1 egg, and 0.06 cups extra-virgin olive oil in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade or an electric mixer fitted with a dough hook.
Mix or process until the dough forms a ball.
Turn the dough out into a clean bowl and cover with a damp towel.
Let it rest at room temperature for at least 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Using a pasta machine or a rolling pin, roll out the dough until it is very thin, like lasagna.
You should have approximately 1 sheet, about 6 by 10-inches.
Place the dough on a baking sheet and brush very lightly with 0.06 cups of the remaining olive oil.
Sprinkle lightly with 0.25 teaspoons kosher salt, 0.25 teaspoons thyme, and 0.06 cups finely chopped onion.
Bake the matzoh for about 10 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.

original_instructions:
Set a frying pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper and cook until cooked through, about 6 minutes. Set aside.
In the same pan, saute the asparagus in 1 tablespoon of the butter over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Set aside.
In another pan, saute the shallots in the remaining 1 tablespoon butter for 1 minute, then add the garlic and saute for another minute. Add the mushrooms and saute anther three minutes. Add the wine and cook until the mixture is reduced to a paste-like consistency, about five minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle half of the cheese over half of the tortilla. Spread the mushroom mixture evenly over cheese. Top with the asparagus, chicken and bacon and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Fold up the tortilla and heat it in a pan until cheese has melted and the tortilla is golden. Serve.
ingredients: 3 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into small cubes
step_by_step_instructions: Set a frying pan over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper and cook until cooked through, about 6 minutes.
Set the chicken aside.
In the same pan, saute the asparagus in 0.67 tablespoon of butter over medium heat for about 4 minutes.
Set the asparagus aside.
In another pan, saute the shallots in 0.67 tablespoon of butter for 1 minute.
Add the garlic and saute for another minute.
Add the mushrooms and saute another 3 minutes.
Add the wine and cook until the mixture is reduced to a paste-like consistency, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle 2 ounces of cheese over half of the tortilla.
Spread the mushroom mixture evenly over the cheese.
Top with the asparagus, chicken, and bacon, and sprinkle with the remaining 2 ounces of cheese.
Fold up the tortilla and heat it in a pan until the cheese has melted and the tortilla is golden.
Serve.

original_instructions: In a large mug or small bowl, combine the oil and red onion. Microwave until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken, quinoa, beans, salsa, cumin, chili powder and salt and pepper to taste then stir and microwave for another minute or two. Serve with toppings of your choice.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Suggested toppings: diced avocado, shredded cheese, chopped fresh cilantro, freshly squeezed lime juice
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.33 teaspoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon diced red onion in a large mug or small bowl.
Microwave until the onion is softened, about 1 to 2 minutes.

Add 0.25 cup cooked chicken, 0.25 cup cooked quinoa, 2 tablespoons black beans, 0.67 tablespoon salsa, 0.17 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.08 teaspoon chili powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir the mixture.
Microwave for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve with toppings of your choice.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and salt. In another bowl, whisk together the milk, butter, and eggs. Make a well in the flour, pour in the milk mixture, and whisk to make a smooth batter. Set batter aside for 10 minutes.
Heat a non-stick or well-seasoned 6-cup popover pan in the oven for 5 minutes. Carefully remove the pan from the oven and brush the inside of the cups with the shortening. Ladle the batter into the cups and bake for 20 minutes, without opening the oven. (Do not open the oven during baking.)
Lower the heat to 350 degrees F. and continue to bake the popovers for 20 minutes, at this point they will be golden brown. Right after removing the popovers from the oven, poke each one with a paring knife to release steam. Turn popovers from the pan and serve immediately with butter and jam.
ingredients: 1 cup whole or non-fat milk, warmed
2 tablespoons unsalted butter or oil, melted
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
In a medium bowl, whisk together 0.17 cup of flour and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, whisk together 0.17 cup of milk, 0.33 tablespoon of butter, and 0.5 egg.
Make a well in the flour, pour in the milk mixture, and whisk to make a smooth batter.
Set batter aside for 10 minutes.
Heat a non-stick or well-seasoned popover cup in the oven for 5 minutes.
Carefully remove the pan from the oven and brush the inside of the cup with 0.5 teaspoon of shortening.
Ladle the batter into the cup and bake for 20 minutes, without opening the oven.
Lower the heat to 350 degrees F and continue to bake the popover for 20 minutes until golden brown.
Right after removing the popover from the oven, poke it with a paring knife to release steam.
Turn the popover from the pan and serve immediately with butter and jam.

original_instructions:
Brown ground beef and drain. Sprinkle in the flour. Add onion soup, stir and cook until meat mixture is thickened and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Spread mustard and mayonnaise, to taste, on bread. Spoon the ground beef mixture onto bread and top with onion.
ingredients: White or whole-wheat bread or buns
step_by_step_instructions: Brown 4 ounces of lean ground beef in a pan and drain the excess fat.
Sprinkle approximately 0.75 tablespoons of all-purpose flour over the beef.
Add 4 ounces of French onion soup to the pan.
Stir the mixture and cook until it thickens and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Spread yellow mustard and mayonnaise to taste on a slice of bread or bun.
Spoon the beef mixture onto the bread.
Top with a few onion rings from the medium onion.

recipe_title: Seared Dayboat Scallops with Napa Cabbage and Chipotle Broth
original_instructions: Remove side muscle from scallops and discard. Drizzle a tablespoon or two of olive oil over scallops and season with salt and pepper. To serve: Heat tablespoons of oil, preferably in a non-stick skillet, over moderately high heat. Quickly sear scallops on both sides until golden brown but still slightly translucent in the center. Be careful not to overcook -- the whole process should take 2-3 minutes. Wipe out saute pan and heat another tablespoon of oil. Saute cabbage briefly until crisp tender (1-2 minutes) with 2-3 drops of sesame oil, if desired. Divide cabbage among 6 large, shallow soup plates and mound in center. Sprinkle a heaping tablespoon or two of rice beans around cabbage and ladle an ounce or two of stock on beans. Place scallops on top of cabbage and garnish with chopped chives and drops of tangerine oil. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 5 cups very finely shredded Napa cabbage
Chopped fresh chives and tangerine olive oil
step_by_step_instructions: Remove the side muscle from approximately 4 ounces of scallops and discard.
Drizzle about 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil over the scallops and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil in a non-stick skillet over moderately high heat.
Quickly sear scallops on both sides until golden brown but still slightly translucent in the center. This should take about 2-3 minutes.
Wipe out the sauté pan and heat another 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil.
Sauté about 0.75 cup of Napa cabbage for 1-2 minutes until crisp-tender, adding 1 drop of sesame oil if desired.
Place the sautéed cabbage on a large shallow soup plate.
Sprinkle about 2 tablespoons of rice beans around the cabbage.
Ladle approximately 1 ounce of shellfish-chipotle stock over the beans.
Place the seared scallops on top of the cabbage.
Garnish with chopped chives and a few drops of tangerine olive oil.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: In a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, add the oil, garlic and onion. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and saute until the onion gets tender and aromatic, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and stir well. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, stirring frequently and breaking it apart, about 5 minutes. Add the chili powder and cumin and stir until evenly distributed. Stir in the tomato sauce and broth and lower the heat to a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, 30 minutes. Stir in the barbecue sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes. Serve hot.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound lean ground beef (at least 90 percent lean)
step_by_step_instructions: In a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, add 0.33 teaspoon of olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove, and 0.33 medium onion diced. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and saute until the onion gets tender and aromatic, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 0.33 tablespoon of tomato paste and stir well.
Add approximately 5.33 ounces of lean ground beef and cook until browned, stirring frequently and breaking it apart, about 5 minutes.
Add 0.67 tablespoon of chili powder and 0.33 teaspoon of ground cumin and stir until evenly distributed.
Stir in 5 ounces of tomato sauce and 0.33 cup of chicken broth. Lower the heat to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
Stir in 1 tablespoon of barbecue sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

original_instructions:
Dry out bread cubes in a low oven (325 degreesF) for 20 minutes; they should be dry but not browned. Meanwhile, mash garlic with 1/4 teaspoon salt in 2 tablespoons oil and set aside for 20 minutes. Strain oil through a sieve into a saute pan and heat over low heat. Add croutons, toss to coat and saute until they are lightly colored.
In a large salad bowl toss romaine leaves with remaining tablespoon olive oil, until well-coated. Add lemon juice and Worcestershire sauce, break egg over salad, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss salad, scooping leaves from the bottom and turning gently, taking care not to break them. Add croutons and serve immediately on chilled plates.
ingredients: 1 cup cubed homemade-style white or Italian bread (1/2-inch croutons)
1 medium head romaine lettuce, leaves separated, washed, dried and chilled
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Cube 0.25 cup of homemade-style white or Italian bread into 1/2-inch croutons.
Place bread cubes on a baking sheet and dry in the oven for about 20 minutes or until they are dry but not browned.
While the bread is drying, mash 0.25 of a garlic clove with about 0.06 teaspoon of salt in 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil and let it sit for 20 minutes.
Strain the garlic oil through a sieve into a small saute pan and heat over low heat.
Add the dried croutons to the pan, toss to coat them with the oil, and saute until they are lightly colored.
In a large salad bowl, toss about 0.25 of a medium head of romaine lettuce with 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil until well-coated.
Add the juice of 0.125 lemon and about 0.75 drop of Worcestershire sauce to the lettuce.
Break 0.25 of an egg, boiled for 1 minute, over the salad.
Sprinkle about 0.5 tablespoon of freshly-grated Parmesan cheese over the salad.
Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
Gently toss the salad, scooping leaves from the bottom and turning gently to avoid breaking them.
Add the croutons to the salad and serve immediately on a chilled plate.

recipe_title: Sole Meuniere with Balsamic Brown Butter Sauce
original_instructions:
Soak fillets in milk for 20 minutes. Remove from milk and pat dry.
Season fillets with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil over moderate heat in each of 2 large saute pans until hot.
Put flour into a shallow dish and season with salt and pepper. Dredge fillets in flour, shaking off any excess flour. Dip the fillets back into the milk and then again into the flour. Place fillets in saute pans and cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Transfer fillets from pans to a platter, sprinkle with parsley.
Wipe the skillet clean and add the butter. Heat until the butter begins to brown. Remove from heat and stir in balsamic vinegar. Pour sauce over fish and serve. Garnish with lemon slices.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 to 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, or to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Soak 1 sole fillet in 0.5 cup milk for 20 minutes.
Remove the fillet from milk and pat dry.
Season the fillet with salt and pepper.
Heat 0.5 tablespoon olive oil over moderate heat in a large saute pan until hot.
Put 0.25 cup flour into a shallow dish and season with salt and pepper.
Dredge the fillet in flour, shaking off any excess flour.
Dip the fillet back into the milk and then again into the flour.
Place the fillet in the saute pan and cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Transfer the fillet from the pan to a platter and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon finely chopped parsley.
Wipe the skillet clean and add 1.5 tablespoons butter.
Heat until the butter begins to brown.
Remove from heat and stir in 0.5 tablespoon balsamic vinegar.
Pour the sauce over the fish and serve.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

original_instructions:
1. Melt the butter in a heavy pan over medium heat. 2. Add the shallots and saut until soft, about 3 minutes. 3. Add the coriander and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. 4. Add the carrots, juice, honey, salt, pepper, and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a simmer. 5. Cover and cook until the carrots are tender, about 20 minutes. 6. Remove from heat, mash with a fork or potato masher, and serve.
1. Melt the butter in a heavy pan over medium heat.
2. Add the shallots and saut until soft, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the coriander and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds.
4. Add the carrots, juice, honey, salt, pepper, and 1/2 cup water. Bring to a simmer.
5. Cover and cook until the carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.
6. Remove from heat, mash with a fork or potato masher, and serve.
ingredients: 1 pound carrots, peeled and cut into 1-inch rounds
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Melt about 0.5 tablespoon of unsalted butter in a heavy pan over medium heat.
Add approximately 0.5 tablespoon of chopped shallots and sauté until soft, about 3 minutes.
Add 0.08 teaspoon of ground coriander and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds.
Add about 0.25 pound of carrots, 0.13 cup of orange juice, 0.33 teaspoon of honey, a pinch of kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, and 0.13 cup of water. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook until the carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat, mash with a fork or potato masher, and serve.

recipe_title: Cumin-Roasted Shrimp with Green Chile Cocktail Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Toss the shrimp with 2 tablespoons of the oil, the cumin, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast, tossing once, until opaque throughout, 4 to 6 minutes.
Meanwhile, pulse the peppers, cilantro, the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil, lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a food processor until smooth.
Serve the shrimp hot, cold or at room temperature with the sauce. (The sauce can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 3 days.)
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds peeled and deveined large shrimp, tails on
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Two 4.5-ounce cans chopped green chile peppers
1/2 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Toss approximately 6.75 ounces of shrimp with 0.9 tablespoons olive oil, 0.11 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.45 teaspoon kosher salt, and 0.23 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper on a rimmed baking sheet.
Roast the shrimp, tossing once, until opaque throughout, around 4 to 6 minutes.

Meanwhile, pulse 1.8 ounces chopped green chile peppers, 0.06 cup fresh cilantro leaves, 0.9 tablespoons olive oil, 0.45 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 0.23 teaspoon kosher salt, and 0.23 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper in a food processor until smooth.
Serve the shrimp hot, cold, or at room temperature with the sauce.

original_instructions:
Wash the chicken parts thoroughly and dry them on paper towels. Heat the fat to 380 degrees in a heavy cast-iron skillet. Place the flour, cornmeal, and seasonings in a brown paper bag. Add the chicken pieces, a few at a time, and shake well to ensure that each piece is coated with the seasoned flour.
Put the chicken pieces in the frying pan and fry uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes, turning occasionally to make sure that each side is golden brown. Remove the chicken pieces and drain them on pieces of brown paper bag. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1 (2 1/2 to 3 pound) chicken, cut into pieces
Bacon fat and lard for frying
step_by_step_instructions: Wash about 1/4 of the chicken parts thoroughly and dry them on paper towels.
Heat approximately 2 tablespoons of bacon fat and lard in a heavy cast-iron skillet to 380 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place 1/8 cup flour, 1/8 cup yellow cornmeal, and a pinch of Bell's poultry seasoning, salt, and pepper in a brown paper bag.
Add a portion of the chicken pieces to the bag, a few at a time, and shake well to coat each piece with the seasoned flour.
Put the coated chicken pieces in the frying pan.
Fry uncovered for 20 to 25 minutes, turning occasionally to ensure each side is golden brown.
Remove the chicken pieces and drain them on pieces of brown paper bag.
Serve hot.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and grease and flour an 8 by 12 inch cake pan, knocking out excess flour.
In a bowl whisk together flour, sugar, cornstarch, poppyseeds, baking powder, and salt and with fingers blend in butter until incorporated. In a large measuring cup, lightly beat together milk, zest, vanilla and egg.
Stir milk mixture into flour mixture until just blended and pour batter into pan. Bake cake for 35 minutes or until tester comes out clean. Remove cake from pan and cool on rack.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Grease and flour a small portion of an 8 by 12 inch cake pan, knocking out excess flour.
In a bowl, whisk together approximately 0.16 cup flour, 0.08 cup sugar, 0.06 cup cornstarch, 0.01 tablespoon poppyseeds, 0.28 teaspoon baking powder, and 0.12 teaspoon salt.
With fingers, blend in about 0.27 tablespoon butter until incorporated.
In a large measuring cup, lightly beat together about 0.13 cup milk, 0.27 teaspoon lemon zest, 0.2 teaspoon vanilla, and about 0.2 of an egg.
Stir milk mixture into flour mixture until just blended.
Pour a portion of the batter into the prepared section of the pan.
Bake cake for approximately 35 minutes or until a tester comes out clean.
Remove cake from pan and cool on rack.

original_instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepan or fryer to 365 degrees F or until a piece of tortilla sizzles when immersed. Fry the tortillas in batches and fry until crisp, about 2 minutes, remove and drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining tortillas. Mix together the cumin and salt in a small bowl. Season the chips with the cumin-salt mixture while still warm.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat approximately 1.2 cups of peanut oil in a large saucepan or fryer to 365 degrees F or until a piece of tortilla sizzles when immersed.
Cut 1 (8-inch) flour tortilla into eighths.
Fry the tortilla pieces in the hot oil until crisp, about 2 minutes.
Remove the chips and drain on paper towels.
Mix together 0.3 tablespoons of cumin powder and 0.2 tablespoons of kosher salt in a small bowl.
Season the chips with the cumin-salt mixture while still warm.

recipe_title: Snow Pea and Napa Cabbage Slaw
original_instructions: In a large saucepan of boiling water blanch snow peas 15 seconds and transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain snow peas well and slice thin diagonally. In large bowl toss snow peas with remaining ingredients and salt and pepper to taste.;
ingredients: 1/2 pound snow peas, trimmed and strings discarded
1 1/2 pounds Napa cabbage, cut into thin shreds (about 9 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil.
Blanch approximately 1.33 ounces of snow peas in the boiling water for 15 seconds.
Transfer the blanched snow peas with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop the cooking process.
Drain the snow peas well and slice them thinly on the diagonal.

In a large bowl, combine the sliced snow peas with about 1.5 cups of shredded Napa cabbage, 0.33 shredded carrot, 0.17 tablespoon of ginger juice, 0.17 tablespoon of rice vinegar, 0.5 tablespoon of vegetable oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
Toss all the ingredients together until they are well mixed.

recipe_title: Grilled Ham, Cheese and Mushroom Sandwiches
original_instructions:
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. When very hot, add 1/2 tablespoon butter and half of the mushrooms; cook, stirring, until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and repeat with 1/2 tablespoon more butter and the remaining mushrooms; transfer to the bowl. Add the herbs to the bowl and toss; season with salt and pepper. Wipe out the skillet.
Build the sandwiches: Spread each slice of bread with mustard and sandwich with the cheddar, ham, mushroom mixture and muenster.
Melt 1 tablespoon butter in the skillet over low heat. Add the sandwiches and cook, turning once and adding more butter if needed, until the bread is golden and the cheese melts, about 12 minutes.
Photograph by Christopher Testani
ingredients: 3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley and/or chives
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
Dijon or whole-grain mustard, for spreading
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
When very hot, add 0.08 tablespoon butter and 0.75 ounce mushrooms; cook, stirring, until tender, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a bowl and repeat with 0.08 tablespoon more butter and the remaining mushrooms; transfer to the bowl.
Add 0.38 tablespoon herbs to the bowl and toss; season with salt and pepper.
Wipe out the skillet.
Spread each slice of bread with mustard.
Build the sandwich by layering 1 slice cheddar, 2 slices ham, some mushroom mixture, and 1 slice muenster between 2 slices of bread.
Melt 0.13 tablespoon butter in the skillet over low heat.
Add the sandwich and cook, turning once and adding more butter if needed, until the bread is golden and the cheese melts, about 12 minutes.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a large pot over low heat. Add the onion; cook 10 minutes. Crumble in the sausage; brown over medium-high heat about 10 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Heat the oil in a large pot over low heat. Add the onion; cook 10 minutes. Crumble in the sausage; brown over medium-high heat about 10 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
ingredients: 1 pound sweet Italian sausage, removed from casing
2 pounds leftover roast beef , cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
2 cups drained canned Italian plum tomatoes, crushed
1 tablespoon chopped chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tbsp olive oil in a large pot over low heat.
Add 0.25 of a large onion, diced into 1/2-inch pieces; cook for 10 minutes.
Crumble in 0.25 lb sweet Italian sausage; brown over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes.
Stir in 0.25 tsp chili powder, 0.25 tsp ground cumin, 0.125 tsp dried oregano, and 0.0625 tsp crushed red-pepper flakes.

Add 0.5 cup diced leftover roast beef, 0.5 cup crushed canned Italian plum tomatoes, 0.5 cup beef broth, 1.5 tbsp tomato paste, 0.25 tbsp chopped chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, 0.25 tbsp brown sugar, and 0.25 of a red bell pepper diced into 1/2-inch pieces.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with olive oil.
Combine the crackers and corn cereal crumbs, sesame seeds, cayenne, and garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Reserve.
In a large bowl, combine egg whites, yogurt, Dijon mustard, and salt. Add the chicken pieces and coat thoroughly with the yogurt mixture.
One at a time, dip the chicken pieces in the cracker mixture, packing crumbs onto chicken. Arrange the chicken on a baking sheet and spray lightly with olive oil cooking spray.
Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with a knife.
ingredients: 1/2 sleeve (about 20) whole-grain salted crackers, pulsed in a food processor until fine (about 1/2 cup)
2 1/2 cups corn cereal flakes, pulsed in a food processor to fine crumbs (about 1/2 cup)
4 medium sized skinless chicken breasts and 4 skinless chicken thighs, rinsed and patted dry (about 3 1/2 pounds chicken)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F.
Lightly spray a baking sheet with olive oil.

Combine approximately 0.06 cups of whole-grain salted cracker crumbs, 0.06 cups of corn cereal crumbs, 0.25 teaspoons of sesame seeds, 0.09 teaspoons of cayenne pepper, and 0.06 teaspoons of garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Reserve this mixture.
In a large bowl, combine 0.25 egg whites, 0.13 cups of lowfat plain yogurt, 0.06 tablespoons of Dijon mustard, and 0.06 teaspoons of salt.
Add one portion of chicken breast or thigh (about 0.44 pounds) to the yogurt mixture and coat thoroughly.
Dip the coated chicken piece into the cracker mixture one at a time, packing crumbs onto the chicken.
Arrange the chicken on the prepared baking sheet and spray lightly with olive oil cooking spray.
Bake in the oven for 45 to 50 minutes, or until juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a knife.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch square baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Set aside.
In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together milk, oil and egg or egg whites. Pour the wet ingredients over the dry and, using a fork, stir until just combined. Do not overmix. Spread batter evenly in pan and bake 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cut into squares or triangles and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 large egg or 2 large egg whites, lightly beaten
step_by_step_instructions: Heat oven to 400 degrees F.
Spray a 9-inch square baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
Combine 0.25 cup flour, 0.25 cup yellow cornmeal, 0.75 tablespoon sugar, 0.38 teaspoon baking powder, and 0.13 teaspoon coarse grained salt in a large bowl. Set aside.
In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together 0.25 cup skim milk, 1 tablespoon canola oil, and 0.5 large egg, lightly beaten.
Pour the wet ingredients over the dry ingredients and, using a fork, stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Spread batter evenly in pan.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cut into squares or triangles and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Heat canola oil in a saute pan and cook onions over medium heat until they caramelize.
Heat grill. Form ground beef into 8 (2-inch) patties. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and grill burgers until medium rare, remove to a platter and top with cheddar cheese slices to allow melting.
Use a 2-inch circle cutter (or biscuit cutter) to cut the potato rolls into circles. Place burgers in rolls and top burgers with caramelized onion.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.38 tablespoon canola oil in a saute pan and cook 0.13 large red onion over medium heat until they caramelize.
Heat grill.
Form ground beef into 1 (2-inch) patty.
Season with 0.25 teaspoon garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Grill burger until medium rare, remove to a plate and top with 0.25 ounce Cheddar cheese slices to allow melting.
Use a 2-inch circle cutter to cut 1 potato roll into a circle.
Place burger in roll and top with caramelized onion.

original_instructions:
Rub the salt, pepper and pepper flakes into the ribs and place into a glass baking dish. Pour the vinegar over the ribs and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight, rotating the ribs in the vinegar twice.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Drain the vinegar from the baking dish and roast the ribs for 1 1/2 hours. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees. Remove ribs from oven and brush with some barbecue sauce. Return ribs to oven and roast for another 30 minutes or until tender. Serve ribs with extra barbecue sauce.
step_by_step_instructions: Rub approximately 0.33 teaspoon salt, 0.33 teaspoon pepper, and 0.33 teaspoon red pepper flakes into a single serving of ribs (about 0.5 lb).
Place the ribs into a glass baking dish.
Pour approximately 0.25 cup of white vinegar over the ribs.
Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight, rotating the ribs in the vinegar twice during this time.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
Drain the vinegar from the baking dish.
Roast the ribs for 1.5 hours in the preheated oven.
Increase the oven temperature to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
Remove ribs from the oven and brush with some barbecue sauce.
Return the ribs to the oven and roast for another 30 minutes or until tender.
Serve the ribs with extra barbecue sauce.

original_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Cut the meatballs in half and place in the oven. Bake until the meatballs are warmed, 3 to 4 minutes. Cut the roll horizontally (careful not to cut all the way through.) Place the warmed meatballs on one side of the roll. Spread the sauce evenly over the meatballs and the other side of the roll. Spread the mozzarella over the meatballs. Spread the Parmesan over the other side of the roll. Sprinkle the oregano over the entire roll. Place the sub in the oven and bake until the cheeses are melted and the edges of the roll are browned, 2 to 3 minutes.
ingredients: Three 3-ounce meatballs, homemade or store bought
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Cut one 3-ounce meatball in half and place in the oven.
Bake until the meatball is warmed, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Cut a 4-inch section of the sub roll horizontally, being careful not to cut all the way through.
Place the warmed meatball halves on one side of the roll.
Spread 1 ounce of red sauce evenly over the meatball halves and the other side of the roll.
Spread 0.67 ounces of shredded whole milk mozzarella over the meatball halves.
Spread 0.33 ounces of grated Parmesan over the other side of the roll.
Sprinkle 0.08 ounces of dried oregano over the entire roll.
Place the sub in the oven and bake until the cheeses are melted and the edges of the roll are browned, about 2 to 3 minutes.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
Combine ingredients in a large shallow baking dish or a bean pot; stir to combine. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. Stir, and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredients: 1 medium green bell pepper, seeded, deveined and cut into 1/4-inch dice
1/2 cup Big Bob Gibson Championship Red Sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

Combine 14.00 oz baked beans, 0.83 oz green bell pepper, 0.42 oz onion, 0.08 cup Worcestershire sauce, 0.08 cup Big Bob Gibson Championship Red Sauce, 0.08 cup light brown sugar, and 0.33 tbsp yellow mustard in a large shallow baking dish or a bean pot; stir to combine.
Bake uncovered for 45 minutes.
Stir the mixture, and cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Serve warm.
processed_ingredients: 0.08 cup Big Bob Gibson Championship Red Sauce

original_instructions: In a pot bring the stock to a boil. Then remove the pot from the flame and add beaten egg whites steadily, beating them into the soup as you pour. Add the sliced scallions, stir in. Remove to a heated tureen and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: In a pot, bring 1 cup of chicken stock to a boil.
Remove the pot from the flame.
Add 1 beaten egg white steadily while beating it into the soup as you pour.
Add approximately 1 tablespoon of finely sliced scallion greens and stir in.
Remove to a heated tureen and serve.

original_instructions: Combine all ingredients and marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Grill over medium heat and enjoy with your choice of salsa and tortilla.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds meat, any cut desired (beef or pork)
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 6 ounces of meat, 0.17 ounces of diced red onion, juice from 0.17 lemon, and seasoning salt to taste.
Marinate the mixture overnight in the refrigerator.
Grill the marinated meat over medium heat until cooked to your liking.
Enjoy the carne asada with your choice of salsa and tortilla.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 250°F. Toss kale with oil in large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange leaves in single layer on 2 large baking sheets. Bake until crisp, about 30 minutes for flat leaves and up to 33 minutes for wrinkled leaves. Transfer leaves to rack to cool.
Preheat oven to 250°F. Toss kale with oil in large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange leaves in single layer on 2 large baking sheets. Bake until crisp, about 30 minutes for flat leaves and up to 33 minutes for wrinkled leaves. Transfer leaves to rack to cool.
ingredients: 12 large Tuscan kale leaves, rinsed, dried, cut lengthwise in half, center ribs and stems removed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 250°F.
Rinse and dry 3 large Tuscan kale leaves. Cut them lengthwise in half, removing the center ribs and stems.
Toss the kale leaves with 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in a large bowl.
Sprinkle the kale leaves with salt and pepper.
Arrange the leaves in a single layer on a large baking sheet.
Bake until crisp, about 30 minutes for flat leaves and up to 33 minutes for wrinkled leaves.
Transfer the leaves to a rack to cool.

original_instructions:
Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat until warmed. Add the oil. During heating, dip the chicken breasts into the eggs, and then dust each breast with seasoned flour on both sides. Once floured, add to the oiled pan, reduce the heat to medium and cook until light brown in color, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and repeat cooking for a final 3 to 4 minutes. Once cooked, remove the breasts from the pan and allow to finish with carry-over cooking.
Return the same pan to the heat and add the stock. Allow to simmer and reduce by three-quarters of the volume. After reducing, whisk in the butter to create a sauce, removing from the heat during the process. Finally, finish with lemon juice and parsley and serve over the chicken.
step_by_step_instructions: 1. Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat until warmed.
2. Add 0.5 tablespoon of grapeseed oil to the pan.
3. Dip 1 chicken breast into 1 beaten egg.
4. Dust the chicken breast with 1 tablespoon of seasoned flour on both sides.
5. Add the floured chicken breast to the oiled pan.
6. Reduce the heat to medium and cook until light brown in color, about 3 to 4 minutes.
7. Flip the chicken breast and repeat cooking for another 3 to 4 minutes.
8. Once cooked, remove the chicken breast from the pan and allow to rest.
9. Return the same pan to the heat and add 0.25 cup of chicken stock.
10. Allow the stock to simmer and reduce by three-quarters of the volume.
11. After reducing, whisk in 1 tablespoon of butter to create a sauce, removing from the heat during the process.
12. Finish the sauce with 0.5 tablespoon of lemon juice and 0.25 teaspoon of minced fresh parsley.
13. Serve the sauce over the cooked chicken breast.

original_instructions: Puree all ingredients for chimichurri in a blender until just blended. Grill beef skewers and brush chimichurri on during the last few minutes of cooking. Serve more chimichurri on the side as a condiment.
ingredients: 1 pound filet mignon, cut in 1-inch cubes, coated with olive oil and divided among 4 skewers
step_by_step_instructions: Puree all ingredients for chimichurri in a blender until just blended.
Grill beef skewer and brush chimichurri on during the last few minutes of cooking.
Serve more chimichurri on the side as a condiment.

recipe_title: Curried Egg Salad on Whole Wheat Bread
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a medium bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, mayonnaise, curry powder, to taste, and stir well to combine. Add the eggs and green onions and season with salt and pepper. Gently fold the eggs into the yogurt mixture and taste for seasoning.
Lay 3 slices of bread on the work service. Divide the curried egg salad evenly among the bread slices, and top each slice with 1 piece red leaf lettuce. Top with the remaining slices of bread. Cut the sandwiches into quarters and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon curry powder, or as needed
4 hard-boiled eggs, peeled, halved, and finely chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium bowl, combine 0.10 cup Greek yogurt, 0.38 tablespoon mayonnaise, and 0.05 teaspoon curry powder. Stir well.
Add 0.67 finely chopped hard-boiled eggs and 0.17 finely chopped green onion to the bowl.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Gently fold the eggs into the yogurt mixture. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Lay 1 slice of whole wheat bread on a work surface.
Spread the curried egg salad evenly over the bread slice.
Top with 1 piece of red leaf lettuce.
Place another slice of bread on top.
Cut the sandwich into quarters.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and adjust the racks to the center of the oven. Fit a roasting pan with a V-rack.
Mix together the honey, olive oil, cinnamon, smoked paprika and some salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Sprinkle the cavity of the chicken with salt and pepper. Stuff the cavity with the rosemary sprigs and lemon slices. Place the chicken in the V-rack-fitted roasting pan. Sprinkle the outside of the chicken with salt and pepper. Tie the drumsticks together using butcher's twine. Brush the outside of the chicken with about half of the honey glaze.
Transfer the chicken to the hot oven. Roast about 30 minutes, and then brush the glaze on the chicken once more. Continue to roast the chicken until the skin is golden brown and crisp , and an instant-read thermometer reaches 165 degrees when inserted in the thickest part of the thighs, about 45 minutes longer.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 4-pound roasting chicken, rinsed, dried and giblets removed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and adjust the racks to the center of the oven.
Fit a roasting pan with a V-rack.
Mix together approximately 0.25 tablespoons honey, 0.25 tablespoons olive oil, 0.06 teaspoons ground cinnamon, 0.06 teaspoons smoked paprika, and a pinch of salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Sprinkle the cavity of a portion of chicken with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with a sprig of rosemary and a slice of lemon.
Place the chicken portion in the V-rack-fitted roasting pan.
Sprinkle the outside of the chicken with salt and pepper.
Tie the drumsticks together using butcher's twine.
Brush the outside of the chicken with about half of the honey glaze prepared earlier.
Transfer the chicken to the hot oven and roast about 8 minutes.
Brush the glaze on the chicken once more.

Continue to roast the chicken until the skin is golden brown and crisp, and an instant-read thermometer reaches 165 degrees F when inserted in the thickest part of the thighs, about 12 minutes longer.

original_instructions:
Place potatoes in a small saucepan covered with cold water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, and cook for 1 1/2 minutes. Remove from heat and drain.
Heat heavy cream in a medium saucepan with garlic over medium-low heat until reduced to 2 cups, about 30 minutes. Add drained potatoes, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove garlic and divide cooked potatoes between 2 (6-inch round) gratin dishes or 1 large gratin dish. Sprinkle with cheese, and place under broiler until golden.
ingredients: 2 large Idaho potatoes, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch cubes, unwashed
step_by_step_instructions: Peel and cut 1/2 large Idaho potato into 3/4-inch cubes.
Place the potato cubes in a small saucepan, cover with cold water, add a pinch of salt, and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook for 1 1/2 minutes.
Remove from heat and drain the potatoes.
Heat 1 cup of heavy cream in a medium saucepan with 1/6 head of garlic, sliced horizontally, over medium-low heat until reduced to 1/2 cup, which should take about 30 minutes.
Add the drained potatoes to the cream, season with salt, freshly ground white pepper, and freshly grated nutmeg.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove the garlic slices from the mixture.
Divide the cooked potatoes into 1 (6-inch round) gratin dish.
Sprinkle with 1/2 tablespoon of freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
Place under the broiler until the top is golden.

original_instructions:
In a medium-size saucepan, melt butter. Blend in flour and add milk and chicken broth. Cook and stir until mixture thickens and bubbles, and continue cooking for 1 minute more.
Add lemon juice, snipped parsley, and onion. Stir in celery salt and a dash each of pepper, paprika, and nutmeg. Cool.
In a large mixing bowl, combine sauce with the ground turkey. Chill thoroughly. With wet hands, shape mixture into balls. Roll balls one at a time in bread crumbs.
Lightly shape balls into cones. For each croquette, dip it into the mixture of egg and water, then roll in bread crumbs. Again, dip croquette in egg/flour and roll in bread crumbs. Fry croquettes in deep-fat fryer for approximately 3 minutes or until brown. Drain. Serve with turkey gravy.
ingredients: Dash each pepper, paprika, and nutmeg
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.75 tablespoons butter in a medium-size saucepan.
Blend in 0.06 cups flour.
Add 0.125 cups milk and 0.125 cups chicken broth.
Cook and stir until mixture thickens and bubbles, and continue cooking for 1 minute more.
Add 0.25 teaspoons lemon juice, 0.25 tablespoons snipped parsley, and 0.25 teaspoons grated onion.
Stir in 0.06 teaspoons celery salt and a dash each of pepper, paprika, and nutmeg.
Cool the mixture.
Combine the sauce with 0.5 cups ground turkey in a large mixing bowl.
Chill thoroughly.
With wet hands, shape mixture into a ball.
Roll the ball in 0.09 cups bread crumbs.
Lightly shape the ball into a cone.
Dip the croquette into 0.5 eggs mixed with water, then roll in 0.09 cups bread crumbs.
Again, dip croquette in egg and roll in bread crumbs.
Fry croquette in deep-fat fryer for approximately 3 minutes or until brown.
Drain and serve with turkey gravy.

original_instructions:
Combine all ingredients except chicken breasts. Add chicken breasts to marinade mixture and marinate chicken breasts in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours before grilling.
Preheat grill. Place chicken breasts on the grill and cook until chicken is opaque in center, flipping twice during cooking, about 15 minutes total.
step_by_step_instructions: Combine all ingredients except chicken breasts in a bowl to make the marinade.
Add one chicken breast to the marinade mixture, ensuring it is fully coated.
Marinate the chicken breast in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours.
Preheat the grill to an appropriate temperature for grilling.
Place the marinated chicken breast on the grill and cook until the chicken is opaque in the center, flipping twice during cooking, about 15 minutes total.

recipe_title: Snakehead Fish Smoked In Rice Straw
original_instructions:
Special equipment: 1 thin bamboo stick, about 2 feet (24-inches) in length
Insert the bamboo stick through the fish's mouth, through its body and out the tail. Move the fish along so it's sitting in the middle part of the bamboo stick.
Now dig the base of the stick into the ground, deep enough to make the stick stand on its own upright with the mouth of the fish pointing to the sky.
Pour the cup of water down the fish's mouth, and then form a pyramid like shape with the rice straw, enclosing the fish on the stick.
Carefully, set the rice straw alight and move away.
When the rice straw has finished burning, about 7 minutes, the fish is ready.
Scrape any charred skin with a sharp knife and eat directly off the stick.
ingredients: 1 snakehead fish or mudfish, cleaned and gutted (about 1 1/2 to 2 pounds)
step_by_step_instructions: Insert a thin bamboo stick through the mouth of the snakehead fish, through its body and out the tail. Move the fish along so it's sitting in the middle part of the bamboo stick.
Dig the base of the stick into the ground deep enough to make the stick stand on its own upright with the fish's mouth pointing to the sky.
Pour approximately 0.5 cup of water down the fish's mouth.
Form a pyramid-like shape with approximately 4 pounds of rice straw, enclosing the fish on the stick.
Carefully set the rice straw alight and move away.
Wait for about 7 minutes until the rice straw has finished burning.
Scrape any charred skin from the fish with a sharp knife and eat directly off the stick.

original_instructions:
Preheat the broiler. Melt the butter in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic and rosemary and cook, stirring often, until the onion is soft and just starts browning, about 6 minutes.
Sprinkle in the flour and cook, stirring, until smooth and bubbling, about 2 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water, the milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a gentle simmer. Stir in the ravioli and cook, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli are tender and the sauce thickens, 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove from the heat. Discard the rosemary sprigs and stir in the spinach. Sprinkle with the mozzarella and grana padano. Place the skillet under the broiler until golden and bubbling, about 5 minutes.
Photograph by Ryan Dausch
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
2 ounces low-moisture mozzarella, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1/4 cup grated grana padano or parmesan cheese
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the broiler.
Melt 0.50 tablespoon butter in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
Add approximately 0.12 small onion, finely chopped, 0.25 cloves garlic, minced, and 0.25 sprigs fresh rosemary to the skillet.
Cook, stirring often, until the onion is soft and just starts browning, about 6 minutes.
Sprinkle in 0.03 cup all-purpose flour and cook, stirring, until smooth and bubbling, about 2 minutes.
Stir in 0.25 cup water, 0.25 cup whole milk, 0.06 teaspoon salt, and a few grinds of pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a gentle simmer.
Stir in approximately 4.50 ounces cheese ravioli and cook, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli are tender and the sauce thickens, 5 to 7 minutes.
Remove from the heat and discard the rosemary sprigs.
Stir in 2.50 ounces chopped spinach.
Sprinkle with 0.25 ounces mozzarella and 0.03 cup grated parmesan cheese.
Place the skillet under the broiler until golden and bubbling, about 5 minutes.

original_instructions:
Thinly slice the apples. Toss with the lemon juice in a large bowl.
Make the dressing: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and 1/2 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 8 minutes. Whisk in the vinegar and mustard; remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Whisk in the sour cream and 1/4 cup water.
Add the dressing to the bowl with the apples. Add the ham, watercress and endives. Season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.
Photograph by Con Poulos
ingredients: 1/2 pound deli-sliced Black Forest ham, torn into pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Thinly slice one apple. Toss with a small amount of lemon juice in a large bowl.
Heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add a small portion of the thinly sliced shallots and a pinch of salt to the skillet.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the shallots are golden, about 8 minutes.
Whisk in 0.3 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar and 0.3 tablespoon of dijon mustard; remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
Whisk in 0.3 tablespoon of sour cream and a small amount of water to the shallot mixture to make the dressing.
Add the dressing to the bowl with the apples.
Add a portion of deli-sliced Black Forest ham, watercress, and endives to the bowl.
Season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Set the chickens on a rimmed baking sheet, sprinkle them all over with salt and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil. Roast to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F, taken between the breast and thigh, about 1 hour.
Allow to cool. With two forks, shred all the meat off the bone.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, mayonnaise, grapes, walnuts, celery, apples, chives, lemon juice and big pinches of salt and pepper. Toss well.
To assemble the sandwiches: Fill a leaf of butter lettuce with some chicken salad. Sandwich the stuffed lettuce with two slices of bread spread with mayo. Repeat for the remaining sandwiches. Slice in half and enjoy.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/3 cup mayonnaise, plus more for serving
Country loaf or nice whole-wheat bread, sliced and toasted, for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Set approximately 0.5 lb of chicken on a rimmed baking sheet, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil.
Roast the chicken to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F, about 1 hour.
Allow the chicken to cool, then shred the meat with two forks.

In a large bowl, combine about 0.5 lb of shredded chicken, 1 tbsp mayonnaise, 0.12 cup sliced green grapes, 0.12 cup chopped walnuts, 0.5 rib celery chopped, 0.12 peeled and chopped green apple, 1 tbsp chopped chives, lemon juice from 0.12 lemon, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Toss well.
To assemble, fill a leaf of butter lettuce with some chicken salad.
Sandwich the stuffed lettuce between two slices of bread spread with mayo.
Slice in half and enjoy.

original_instructions:
1. Between pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper, place each chicken breast smooth side down; gently pound with flat side of meat mallet or rolling pin until about 1/2 inch thick. In small shallow dish, mix flour with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper; dip each chicken breast into flour mixture, coating all sides.
2. In 10-inch skillet, heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Cook chicken breasts in oil 6 to 8 minutes, turning once, or until brown. In small bowl, mix cooking sauce and lemon juice.
3. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer 5 to 10 minutes or until juice of chicken is clear when center of thickest part is cut (at least 165 degrees F). Sprinkle with parsley and lemon peel. Serve with rice.
ingredients: 1 can (18 oz) Progresso™ Recipe Starters™ creamy roasted garlic with chicken stock cooking sauce
step_by_step_instructions: 1. Place one chicken breast smooth side down between two pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Gently pound with the flat side of a meat mallet or rolling pin until about 1/2 inch thick.
2. In a small shallow dish, mix about 1 tablespoon of flour with a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper. Dip the chicken breast into the flour mixture, coating all sides.
3. In a 10-inch skillet, heat about 1/2 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
4. Cook the floured chicken breast in the oil for 6 to 8 minutes, turning once, or until brown.
5. In a small bowl, mix approximately 1/4 cup of the cooking sauce with about 3/4 tablespoon of lemon juice.
6. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken in the skillet.
7. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the juice of the chicken is clear when the center of the thickest part is cut (at least 165 degrees F).
8. Sprinkle with a small amount of chopped fresh parsley and grated lemon peel, if desired.
9. Serve the chicken with about 1/2 cup of hot cooked rice, if desired.

original_instructions:
Heat a large, deep skillet over medium high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Add 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, half the chicken pieces, and a couple of crushed cloves of garlic.
Brown chicken 2 minutes on each side and remove from pan. Add remaining oil, another single turn of the pan, remaining chicken pieces and garlic. Brown chicken 2 minutes on each side and remove. Add vinegar to the pan. Let it cook off.
Add butter, shallots, and rosemary to the pan and cook 2 minutes, add flour and cook 1 minute more. Whisk in wine, reduce 1 minute. Whisk in broth and bring liquids up to a bubble. Return chicken to the pan and simmer over moderate heat 7 to 8 minutes to finish cooking chicken through.
Dessert: This is a very rich meal. My suggestion for dessert is to set out a small cookie tray and offer coffee or tea.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large, deep skillet over medium high heat.
Season approximately 0.33 pounds of chicken with salt and pepper.
Add 0.33 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, half of the chicken pieces, and 1 crushed clove of garlic to the skillet.
Brown chicken for 2 minutes on each side and remove from the pan.
Add the remaining 0.17 tablespoons of oil, another single turn of the pan, remaining chicken pieces and garlic.
Brown chicken for 2 minutes on each side and remove from the pan.
Add 0.5 tablespoons of white wine vinegar to the pan and let it cook off.
Add 0.33 tablespoons of butter, 0.33 shallots, and 1 sprig of rosemary to the pan and cook for 2 minutes.
Add 0.33 tablespoons of flour and cook for 1 minute more.
Whisk in 0.17 cups of wine, reduce for 1 minute.
Whisk in 0.33 cups of beef broth and bring liquids up to a bubble.
Return chicken to the pan and simmer over moderate heat for 7 to 8 minutes to finish cooking chicken through.
